info.title: Configure virtual disk cache mode using &vmm;

abstract.para: A virtual disk is an essential part of a virtual machine (VM). To speed up disk reading and writing operations, you can enable a caching mechanism. This article describes how to configure a virtual disk cache mode using &vmm;.

step.para: Start &vmm;, left-click the name of an existing VM, and select Open to open the VM console window.
From the VM console window, click ViewDetails to open the detailed information about the VM's virtual hardware.
From the left list, select the disk for which you want to configure the cache mode and unfold its Advanced options.
From the Chache mode drop-down list, select the cache mode that matches your scenario.

note.para: You may have to restart a running VM for the changes to take effect.
